sn11:9.1.2_0: “Once upon a time, mendicants, several hermits who were ethical, of good character, settled in leaf huts in a wilderness region.
sn11:9.1.3_0: Then Sakka, lord of gods, and Vepacitti, lord of demons, went to those hermits.
sn11:9.1.4_0: Vepacitti put on his boots, strapped on his sword, and, carrying a sunshade, entered the hermitage through the main gate. He walked right past those hermits, keeping them at a distance.
sn11:9.1.5_0: Sakka took off his boots, gave his sword to others, and, putting down his sunshade, entered the hermitage through a gate he happened upon. He stood downwind of those hermits, revering them with joined palms.
sn11:9.1.6_0: Then those hermits addressed Sakka in verse:
sn11:9.2.1_0: ‘The fragrance of the Lord God’s creations,
sn11:9.2.2_0: the odor of their bodies goes with the wind.
